conclusion: To find the position at t = 8s, calculate total displacement and add to initial position.
Initial position at t = 0 is x = 5 meters.
Displacement is the area under the v-t graph.
From t = 0 to t = 2s, velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2 m/s.
Area from t = 0 to t = 2s is 2 meters.
From t = 2 to t = 4s, velocity is constant at 2 m/s.
Area from t = 2 to t = 4s is 4 meters.
From t = 4 to t = 6s, velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s.
Area from t = 4 to t = 6s is 2 meters.
From t = 6 to t = 8s, velocity is constant at -1 m/s.
Area from t = 6 to t = 8s is -2 meters.
